body:
Hi All,

supposing i cythonize this python code :
```
class CanComponent:
    @staticmethod
    def load_multiple_by_keys(array_of_keys):
        return array_of_keys
```

and now suppose i'm calling the static method using the keywords explicit arguments like this : 
```
from CanComponent import CanComponent
my_keys = ['CARD_A', 'CARD_B']
cards = CanComponent.load_multiple_by_keys(array_of_keys=my_keys)
```

This is allowed/running by python3.4 when CanComponent.py is not cythonized
But when cythonized, i got :

> Traceback (most recent call last):
>   File "cards_status.py", line 197, in <module>
>     cards = CanComponent.load_multiple_by_keys(array_of_keys=CARDS_KEYS)
> TypeError: load_multiple_by_keys() takes no keyword arguments

Si i have to update my code to :

```
from CanComponent import CanComponent
my_keys = ['CARD_A', 'CARD_B']
cards = CanComponent.load_multiple_by_keys(my_keys)
```

why cython does not allow that ?

Thanks for your help.
title: Cythonized module change staticmethod call behavior at kwargs level
